description: In [[Hindustani classical music]], the '''jor''' (Hindi: जोर, {{IPA|hns|dʒoːr|}}; also spelt '''jod''' and '''jhor''') is a formal section of composition in the long elaboration (''[[alap]]'') of a [[raga]] that forms the beginning of a performance. It comes after ''[[alap]]'' and precedes ''[[jhala]]'', the climax. Jor is the instrumental equivalent of '''nomtom''' in the [[dhrupad]] vocal style of [[music of India|Indian music]]. Both have a simple [[Pulse (music)|pulse]] but no well-defined [[Tala (music)|rhythmic cycle]].
